TEI.2.document_title: A Huston to Stephen F Austin. Branch T Archer, William Wharton, 01-10-1836

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 301-302

div1.p: In conformity with a special act of the Provisional Government of Texas I have been ordered to this place to Purchase such articles in the Qr Masters Department as are necessary for the immediate sustainance and use of the army I herewith transmit to you a Copy of the articles which I am ordered to purchase and with a high sense qf the importance of that department of our armys being fully and amply supplied I hope you will Loose no time in Placing at my disposal the Necessary means to accomplish that End—

p.person_mentioned: A. Huston Qr. M. Genral Texas Army

div1.p: To Genl S. F Austin B T Archer Wm Wharton Commissioners

p.hi: List of Articles, to be purchased by Col A Huston in N. Orleans

div1.p: 10 Baggage Waggons with Geer for 60 Horses
1 Set of Gunsmiths Tools, with Anvils bellows and portable forge
3 Set of Carpenters tools for field Service
20 Steel Corn Mills a patent portable hand mill
The foregoing is a copy of the articles I am ordered to purchase Except the article of Flour that is only half the amount I am directed to purchase.
